content.description: From Hogge's Book: Start where the ground beings dropping into the dark hole, onthe big matchable block. Power up the almost-bare section, staying off the long small arete used on Eye-Pluck. Escape the rat army across a yawning fissure. '07Book rates it at 11d/12b
content.protection: Toprope was setup traversing from Freddy vs. Jason. Sketchy to setup from top.
content.location: Start where the ground beings dropping into the dark hole

content.description: Great edges down low and big jugs as the angle steepens. Very fun climbing. Must do!
Starts in the pit up good holds to a sandy ledge. Climbs directly up the dihedral using small crimps and interesting moves past the crux to the finish.
content.location: Same start as Freddie vs. Jason.

content.description: A stick clip isn't necessary but advised, since the footholds may be fragile. Soft belay until bolt 2 is clipped to avoid crashing onto the roof edge. Don't miss clipping bolt 3, which sits back in a shallow depression.

Sweet traverse inside the pit. It traverses from left to right through most of the wall's midsection. You traverse by 10 permadraws over airy falls...Bolt 10 is above bolt 9...so start heading up after 9. Shares anchors with Freddy vs. Jason. This route is only for lead! Do not follow...the gates are positioned only for leading.
content.location: Start on the boulder guarding the entrace of the pit...locate the permadraws on the wall...start traverse left to right.

content.description: Fun pumpy route. Great for those breaking into the 11s.
content.protection: To minimize fall distance towards the opposite cliff, use a short draw on bolt 3, clip the biner on the chain hanging from bolt 4, move up, then clip a short draw onto bolt 4's hanger (sharing the chain). The chain alone is too low to protect falls toward the opposite wall.

content.description: This climb has a super tricky crux that makes it hard to onsight, but it is very enjoyable. Overall, its short, but a good time none the less. Must do!

From Hogge's book: Climb using the directional permadraw to keep away from the opposite wall. Unclip as you pass the permadraw and reclip upon lowering. Start just left of the big matchable block . Chased by wolves across shaky ground
content.location: Right end of the mini low roof (I think)

content.description: A short, overhanging route on the left side of the Horror Movie Wall. As of now, it's only a TR...with a directional permadraw to keep you in line. The Crux is below...and its a long move. Start and climb between two directional permadraws.
content.protection: Top Rope...Helmet is recommended since your so close to the opposing wall (D&D Wall)
content.location: As you enter the pit...it will be the second route to your left...its between Cold Damp Embrace and Frankenstein Killed by a Mere Angry Mob. Those two are also TRs.

climbs.name: Demonic Hordes and the Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore

content.description: Shortest Route a M-Rock, but solid, quality, and pumpy. You traverse diagonally on three permadraws across rounded arete. Shares anchors with Freddy vs. Jason. There is a belay anchor right above the boulder for belayer.
content.protection: 3 permadraws, may want to wear helmet due to proximity of opposing wall.
content.location: Route is in between Thing vs. Cousin it and Trollkind. Route starts above the stacked boulder towards back of the pit.

content.description:
Mildly overhanging wall with great shady routes ranging 5.9 to 5.12a/b.  As Dave Phillips puts it, "this wall is full of classics." 

  Some of these routes (ranging 5.10c to 5.12a/b) are on TR because the opposite cliff is too close to lead.  They have directionals to unclip on the way up and reclip upon lowering.  It's fun to project these excellent TR-only routes--no pressure to redpoint! 

  A couple of routes at 10a (Freddie vs. Jason) and 10b (Demonic Hordes and the Evil Eye of Orms by Gore) are short because they start on boulders.  Don't skip them; they're sweet, and the 10a is tricky and usually takes alot of time to figure out. 

  The wall has a progression of popular 11's: Goblin Mutant(5.11a), Texas Chainsaw Massacre (5.11b), Shower Scene from Psycho (TR 5.11c), Eyepluck Scene from The Birds (TR 5.11d).
